breath

[breth] 

noun

1. the air inhaled and exhaled in respiration.

2. respiration, especially as necessary to life.

3. life; vitality.


 

 

Yoongi thinks that it's far too early for such bullshit. Honestly, it's not even ten in the morning, he should be in bed right now, not getting dressed to meet a customer. Yoongi's customers know that business doesn't start until noon, so why even bother? But of course, Yoongi also knows that in this particular case he doesn't really have a choice.

As a drug lord, Yoongi knows the rules:

-you don't ask questions;

-whatever the client wants, you sell it;

-you don't do loans;

-you don't fall in love with a customer's whore.

Those rules applied even harder when the client is Wen Gao.

Wen Gao is a fucking asshole, one of the worst humans that ever stepped on planet Earth, but he's got money. It happens when you're one of the most influential arms dealer of the country. Besides, isn't Gao one of his best clients? He might be scum, but he's rich scum.

So Yoongi makes an effort in looking at least decent, going as far as to wash his face with cold water and even comb his hair. With his fingers because no one has time to actually use a brush. Does he even own a brush? He might need to check.

Yoongi finds a white t-shirt scattered on the floor and since it doesn't smell bad he decides that's good enough for the day. He shrugs on a pair of jeans and finds his leather jacket and calls it a day. Gao might be rich scum but he's not rich scum that Yoongi needs to impress.

As he leaves his comfortably dark room he's welcomed with way too much light. Yoongi sighs and rubs his fingers on his eyes, trying to get accustomed to the sudden brightness. Seokjin must have done something with the shutters as they're all up, letting the sunlight hit the penthouse.

“Fucking windows.” Yoongi mutters, making his way to the kitchen counter “Fucking penthouse basically made of fucking glass.”

Yoongi finds some coffee still in the jug from the night before and decides that he's too lazy to actually make fresh one, so he fills a mug and shoves it rather brutally in the microwave.

He checks his phone. Five minutes to ten. So fucking early. The microwave starts beeping and Yoongi takes the warm cup of coffee, taking a generous sip and sighing contently. Now he can start thinking of business.

The intercom suddenly rings, startling Yoongi who almost loses his grip on his precious mug. After a muttered curse, the man goes to the intercom and answers it.

“What?”

“Sir, Wen Gao is here for you.”

Yoongi frowns at the voice. It's thursday, so it must be Mike at the lobby, right? Then why is his voice so different? No, wait, Mike works in the afternoon, so this must be...

“Let him in, Nate.”

“Yes, sir.”

Gao is early. Yoongi hates people who are early, it's absolutely inconsiderate.

He leans with his back to his desk and waits for Gao to arrive, drinking his coffee slowly and savouring the taste. This was going to be a long day and he had just started.

After a few minutes, someone knocks on the door and Yoongi goes to open it.

Wen Gao is a middle aged man who is very close to be considered a senior citizen, a belly that is large because of too many beers and too much food, small black eyes and a few hair left, grey, that he still refuses to just cut off even though they make him look ridiculous. All in all, Wen Gao looks absolutely mundane, if not hideous. But his suit is hand-made, his shoes italian, his rolex heavy and his bank account fatter than him.

“Min! It's good to see you!” the man exclaims, making his way inside the penthouse as Yoongi stands beck to let him in.

“Gao, it's good to see you too.” Yoongi makes to close the door but Gao stops him.

“I brought someone with me, I hope it's not an inconvenience.” he explains “He was looking for a place to smoke, a balcony or something.”

Yoongi nods.

“He can smoke here.” he says “I don't mind.”

“I'll go fetch him, then.”

Yoongi goes to his couch and sits heavily, stopping himself from yawning loudly. Why would he bring someone else and not even tell him beforehand? Asshole.

Gao comes back a few moments later, an arm snaked around someone's waist, and he closes the door.

Yoongi doesn't look at them as he searches for his own pack of cigarettes in the pockets of his jacket. When he finds it he takes one out and puts it between his lips, lighting it up immediately and letting out a lungful of smoke.

“Please, sit. Can I offer you anything?” Yoongi asks, gesturing for the two armchairs in front of the couch.

“No, thank you.” Gao says as he sits down “Peach, do you want something?”

Peach? At that, Yoongi decides to spare a glance at whoever it is Gao brought with him. He ends up staring. “Peach”, if that's his real name, is a boy. Short but build, small hands with expensive rings adorning his fingers and the prettiest face Yoongi has ever seen on a boy.

This must be Gao's new toy.

Peach doesn't speak, there's a cigarette hanging from his lips, he looks at Yoongi's lighter.

“Need a light?” he asks, lifting his lighter up.

Peach leans down to it, Yoongi can now see how full and plump his lips look, how pretty his eyes are under the heavy kohl. Fuck, he's not just pretty, the kid is a work of art. And he shouts “expensive” from every pore.

Yoongi click the lighter and the flame comes out, lighting up Peach's cigarette. The boy holds his gaze for a second, locks of pink hair covering messily his brow, then he stands back straight and goes to sit on the arm rest, next to Gao. The man holds an arm around his waist, a gesture that looks so possessive it's almost hilarious.

“He's new.” Gao says “Got him a few days ago.”

Yoongi hums. “Does he speak?”

“Only when I ask him to.” Gao's smile is wry “Peach, say hello to mister Min.”

Peach smiles, it doesn't reach his eyes.

“Hello, Yoongi.” he says, voice light and sweet.

“Be respectful, Peach, you can't just call him Yoongi.”

“It's fine, don't really care.” Yoongi inhales some smoke “You brought him here to brag?”

Gao lets out a small laugh “I'm showing him off. After all, I take pride in him. He's a korean like you. Isn't he a beauty?”

Peach cocks his head to the side.

“I guess he is.” Yoongi concedes.

Gao nods.

“You're no fun, Min.”

“I've been told that.” Yoongi sits back more comfortably “Should we get down to business? I'm busy today.”

Gao's face turns serious.

“Of course.” he says as he slips a hand in the pocket of his tailored jacket, taking a piece of paper out and putting it on the small coffee table in front of him “Here's my order for the week.”

Yoongi takes the paper and unfolds it, eyeing it for a few seconds.

“There's more stuff than usual.” he says “You want more Valium than last week. Heroin's the same as usual. Morphine?” Yoongi looks up at Gao.

“I have a man that's been shot pretty badly.” Gao says “We patched him up, but the pain makes him useless and I need him active.”

Yoongi shrugs. “Don't get pissed if he turns into a fucking junkie later on.”

“I sure hope he becomes a junkie.” Gao licks his lips “Junkies are easy to order around, you have too much leverage on them, they become puppets.”

Yoongi can't say Gao's completely wrong.

“You'll get your stuff tomorrow night, usual place.” Yoongi says “Usual hour.”

“Payment's method?”

“Same as always, don't leave tracks.”

“When do I ever?”

Yoongi wants to say that he can name a few instances, but decides to stay quiet.

“Actually, Min, I didn't bring Peach here just to show him off.”

Yoongi arches an eyebrow and shifts his attention on the boy. He looks way too at ease, sitting on that arm rest like he owns it, eyes confidently staring at him. At least he's using one of the ashtrays he found on the coffee table instead of letting the ash fall on the ground.

“From next week, Peach will be the one who places the orders.”

Yoongi frowns. Gao was going to send his fucking boy toy to place drug orders?

“Why?” he asks.

“I'll be real busy starting tomorrow.” Gao clears his voice, his hand sliding up and down Peach's side, lifting his t-shirt a little and showing tanned skin “There's a huge deal coming. A massive order of weapons for really special customers. It will last for a while, it's a partnership that will take all of my time and attention. Can't waste time placing orders.”

“Why him? Why not one of your men?”

At that, Gao actually laughs genuinely, Peach smiling a little as well.

“Fuck, Min, you can't trust men like mine to deal with drugs. Most of them are fucking junkies! But Peach, here... he doesn't like drugs. Not the heavy ones. And he doesn't know the coding we use. Don't worry, Min, Peach will just bring the order to you, then Alec will come and take the drugs at usual. He knows how to deal with them, how to bring them where they need to be... but I wouldn't trust him with the order. It's easy to change something so that he orders more and keeps some for him.”

Yoongi realizes that Gao is right. Once the order is placed no one would actually know if someone had added something. That's the thing about being able to not leave tracks, things are fucking easy to bend at someone's will. The important part was that little piece of paper, not the actual merch.

“Fine.” Yoongi says, smoke coming out of his nostrils “I'll inform the lobby to let him in, he'll have to give them a picture.”

“I love taking pictures.” Peach says, his cigarette burns out and he stomps it in the ashtray.

Yoongi sighs. “Is Peach even his name?”

Gao smirks.

“It is now. We should go, shouldn't we? We took too much time from mister Min anyway.” Gao stands up and Yoongi follows suit, Peach standing up as well, straightening his shirt down “You've been very good, baby. Do you want a reward?”

Peach makes a sound that very much resembles a purr.

“I want new rings.”

“I'll buy an entire jewelry if that's what you want.” Gao turns to Yoongi “I guess I'll see you once I find some time. In the meantime, enjoy Peach's presence.”

Yoongi finds it wise to not say that he will. It's clear that Gao really likes this new one. The previous one was cute as well, well behaved and quiet, but Gao never gave him this much attention. Yoongi knows better than making one of his best clients jealous.

Yoongi guides them to the exit, opening the door for them. Peach turns around before they disappear outside.

“I'll see you soon, Yoongi.” he says with an amused smile.

Yoongi nods and bids his goodbyes, closing the door and waiting for a few seconds before sighing.

It's not even half past ten but he already wants to crawl back to bed.

 

 

 

 

*

 

 

 

“We're getting a new stash of opiates next week. Heroin mostly, hydrocodone too.” Namjoon crosses his legs “Pills are coming soon as well. Seokjin will take care of 'em.”

“Costs?” Yoongi asks.

“Not more than usual.”

“Good, we lost a client last week, don't want to lose incomes.”

“Which client?”

“Wasn't it Alvarez?” Hoseok chimes in the conversation, filling a glass with water from Yoongi's kitchen “Owner of those clubs.”

“Yeah, it's him.” Yoongi sniffs “He got shot.”

“Tough shit.” Namjoon says.

“Kinda asked for it. The idiot tried to get his hands on the woman of a mob boss.”

“Definetely asked for it, then.” Namjoon stands up from the chair and ruffles his blond hair “There should be no loss, though, I've been checking. We're going steady as ever.”

“Good.” Yoongi lets out a breath “Then we're done for today. What time is it?”

“Almost time to order some fucking take out.” Hoseok says “I'm fucking starving.”

“I'm feeling italian.” Namjoon gives Yoongi a look “Italian?”

“Sure.” Yoongi takes his jacket off and tosses it without a care on the floor, smoothing the t-shirt with the palm of his hands.

Hoseok calls the usual italian restaurant and the three men sit on the couch together, lazily looking at whatever bad tv-show that was on in that moment without really paying attention as they wait for their food.

“What's this story that Gao bought some fresh meat?” Hoseok asks.

“Yeah, it's his new toy.” Yoongi answers, scratching his knee “Gao calls him peach.”

“Peach? The fuck?” Namjoon shakes his head “Is he cute?”

“Cute?” Yoongi smiles “That kid's probably the prettiest thing I've ever laid my eyes on. You should see him, he's a fucking masterpiece. All perfect lips and smiles, he's dangerous as hell. Can't be older than twenty.”

“Shit.” Hoseok chuckles “Gao, that old sick fuck, always taking 'em young. He probably can't even get it up with all the shit he snorts.”

Namjoon lets out a low laugh, quiet and pleasurable as always.

“Fucking Gao, thinks he's a hot blooded american when he's chinese. He's fucking asian like us, thinks he's better than us because he thinks he can fool people into believing he wasn't born in Chengdu.” Yoongi shakes his head “That man can't even hide his fucking accent.”

“He tries to sound like he's from Texas.” Namjoon says “He sounds like a chinese trying too hard to sound like he's not from China.”

“If he can't get it up with that kid then he's really a finished man.” Yoongi says “Wonder what happened to the last one. What was his name again?”

“Don't know.” Namjoon replies “Don't want to know what happened to him either.”

Yoongi makes a noise of agreement. “Peach will be placing the orders from now on, Gao's too busy with a new deal.”

“Is it big?”

“Apparently.” Yoongi looks at Namjoon “Why?”

“It's always good to keep tabs on our client's affairs. We don't wanna deal with broke assholes if something goes bad. Still, if he's sending a new toy it means he's reliable. Or that Gao trusts him, at least.”

There's silence for a while, the buzzing of the tv keeping them distracted, before Hoseok speaks.

“Well, would you look at us.” he murmurs “Three strapping young lads, talking about a client's bitch whilst waiting for cheap italian food. Aren't we living the dream? God bless America.”

 

 

 

 

*

 

 

 

 

The week goes by and Yoongi doesn't have to bark orders too much, doesn't have to threaten anyone and doesn't have to break teeth. Which means that it has been a good week.

Thursday arrives and with it Peach arrives as well.

It's four in the afternoon when the intercom buzzes and Mike informs him that “Gao's man is here”, so Yoongi instructs him to let him through.

When he opens the door he doesn't expect to be greeted with a flash of white teeth and a bright smile.

“Hello, Yoongi.” Peach immediately gets inside, not bothering waiting for Yoongi to step back and he almost bounces his way to the couch.

“Someone's taking liberties.” Yoongi says, no real bite in his words.

“I always do.” he says, pulling his pink hair back from his forehead “That's why everyone likes me.”

“I don't.”

“You'll learn to.”

Yoongi sighs.

“Do you want anything? Something to drink?”

“Tea!” Peach exclaims rather cheerfully “Do you have tea?”

Yoongi nods and goes to the kitchen, starts the boiler and waits for the water to be ready.

He gives Peach a quick look, the boy still sitting on the couch with his legs crossed and an amused smile stretching his lips.

“Gao said you're korean.”

The boy nods. “I was born in Busan. Apparently.”

“Apparently?”

He shrugs. “Don't remeber much from those times.”

“You speak korean?”

“Not even a word. I probably used to, though. Can't remember.”

Yoongi decides not to inquire.

“Do you speak korean, Yoongi?”

“Yeah.” Yoongi takes the boiler and fills a mug with hot water, preparing the boy's tea “I was born and raised there.”

“You don't have an accent.”

“Had to make it disappear.”

Peach doesn't ask other questions, Yoongi goes to him and hands him the mug, the boy mutters a thank you and keeps the cup between his hands with a content smile.

As Yoongi sits on one of the armchairs, he realizes that Peach isn't just a pretty boy, he's fucking beautiful. Crazily enough, there's a sort of naive aura around him.

“The order.” Peach takes a piece of paper from the back pocket of his ripped jeans and tosses it on the coffee table, sipping blissfully at his tea.

Yoongi takes it and examines it. It doesn't look like someone tried to change anything, the handwriting is definetely Gao's and Yoongi would recognize that deep blue ink everywhere. The order is real and untouched, the coding message they use for the products is spotless.

“Good. Tell Alec that it's the usual spot and usual time.”

Peach nods, then he frowns. “Do I... do I leave now, or...?”

“I mean, I ain't kickin you out.” Yoongi replies “Finish your tea or whatever.”

Peach seems to relax visibly at his words, and he slumps deeper in the couch.

“Good, 'cause I'm bored out of my mind when owner isn't home.”

The boy's words are processed rather slowly by Yoongi's brain. When he does understand what he has just said, however, Yoongi tries his best to not let his discomfort show.

“Owner?” Yoongi asks.

“That's what he wants me to call him.” Peach replies, completely unfazed.

That's creepy. That's fucking creepy.

“What's your name, kid?”

“I told you, Peach.” he pouts, as if he couldn't get any cuter “Also, don't call me kid. I might not look like it, but I'm twenty two.”

He looks way younger.

“Peach isn't your real name.”

“It's the name I have now.”

“I'm not calling you peach when you're here.” Yoongi says, voice firm. That's the voice he uses with his men when they fuck up. The boy in front of him doesn't even flinch. “What's your real name? I'll call you with that when we're alone.”

The pink haired boy stays quiet for what feels like minutes, the tea in his mug slowly cooling down. He holds his gaze with no trace of fear or intimidation. Then, he finally speaks.

“Jimin.”

Yoongi nods.

“That's a name I can use.”

Jimin tilts his head.

“Owner says you're dangerous. One of the most dangerous men he's ever met. You don't look dangerous.” Jimin drinks some tea “Which is probably what makes you dangerous.”

“You don't look like you're scared of me.”

“Should I?”

Yoongi considers it for a while.

“No.” he finally says.

“Okay.” Jimin looks around himself “I like this place. Owner's house is bigger, but not much light comes in. Shutters are almost always down.”

Yoongi makes a mental note to always leave the shutters up and the windows wide open when Jimin is here. He doesn't know why and he decides to not dwell on it.

“I should go now.” Jimin says, gulping down the rest of his tea “I want to go check a new shop, I like the clothes there. I know where the exit is.”

Yoongi stands up to walk him to the door anyway. “I'll see you next thursday, Jimin.”

“Yes.” Jimin opens the door and, before he steps out, he says “You're cute, Yoongi, but you need to get some sun on your skin, you look like a ghost.”

Then he leaves, smile on his lips and lightness in his steps.

 

 

 

*

 

 

 

“I'm too old for this shit, Yoons.” Seokjin whines, his head lolling and his body slumped on the sofa.

“Is that so?” Yoongi asks, not really listening and staring at the orders on his laptop.

“Yes. My joints hurt. My back hurts. Hell, even my kidneys hurt.”

Yoongi hums.

“Too much fatigue. Lifting those packages is so tiring.”

“Jin, you don't even lift a single gram of those boxes, the

workers do, you just look at them.”

Seokjin snaps his eyes open, staring at Yoongi as if he had just spat on his dog.

“Min Yoongi, I feel their fatigue, I sense it, and therefore it is my fatigue too! Hell, yesterday Shane had in his arms so much cocaine, it must have been so heavy.” he sighs “I felt a crack in my spine just by looking at him.”

Yoongi chuckles and Jin seems satisfied, so he goes back to closing his eyes and resting on Yoongi's couch.

“I've seen Peach last thursday.” Jin suddenly says.

“Yeah?”

“Yeah, as he was leaving the building. He introduced himself to me, he was so cute.” Jin sighs “Absolutely adorable.”

Yoongi hums.

“His name ain't Peach, you know?”

“What's his real name?”

“Jimin.”

“That's a nice name. He's too cute for his own good, all pretty smiles and perfect face.” Jin smile falls quickly “Such a shame, really.”

Yoongi lifts his eyes from his desktop and focuses on Jin. “What do you mean?”

“It's a shame that a boy as sweet as him is Gao's.” Jin's voice is low “A shit like Gao doesn't deserve him.”

Yoongi frowns. Sure, Gao is an old man who has more blood on his hands than Yoongi can even imagine, but he seems to treasure Jimin.

“It looks like he takes good care of him, though.” Yoongi says and Jin's lips turn down, his expression one of disgust.

“For now.” he mutters “I know some real dark shit about Gao.”

“What shit?”

Jin turns to look at him. “Do you know what happened to his last toy?”

Yoongi shrugs.

“Gao's toys are under contract, right?” he asks, Jin nods “Then the contract expired. I'm guessing.”

Jin sends him a sad look as he takes a deep breath.

“No, the contract didn't expire. But in a way, it did.” the man shifts his attention to the ceiling “Gao broke his last toy.”

Yoongi ignores the shiver down his spine. He already knows what Jin means, but he finds himself asking the question anyway.

“What do you mean?”

“He broke him.” Jin repeats “Gao killed the last one with a bullet in the skull.”

 

 

 

*

 

 

 

Thursday comes, the weather starts getting chiller, winter slowly making its way through. When Yoongi opens the door for Jimin, the boy looks almost ethereal, a relaxed smile on his lips and a soft looking huge sweater keeping him warm.

“Hello Yoongi!” Jimin comes inside and immediately goes straight for the couch “Can I smoke?”

“Sure.” Yoongi replies and he decides to sit on the couch as well, keeping a discreet distance from Jimin.

He's not wearing make up today. Yoongi decides he looks better without it.

Jimin takes two cigarettes and offers one to Yoongi, who takes it and lights it up, doing the same for Jimin.

“Here's the order.” Jimin says, giving him the usual piece of paper. Yoongi reads it for a few seconds.

“Still morphine?”

Jimin nods.

“The guy that was shot is already addicted. Is it possible? To get addicted so quickly?”

“With morphine? Yes.” Yoongi replies, sliding the piece of paper in his pocket “Morphine is one of the worst. You link it with the loss of pain so when you don't take it your brain reminds you that you should be in pain.”

Jimin nods.

“I don't like drugs.” he says, breathing out some smoke “Not the really hard ones. They're scary.”

“They are.” Yoongi agrees.

“Owner uses the drug to keep his men loyal. Turns them into junkies. I'm surrounded by zombies there.” Jimin sighs “It's so boring when owner isn't home. That's why I'm happy when I come here, at least I have an excuse to go out and do something. And you're not a zombie.” Jimin looks at him “Do you take drugs?”

Yoongi snorts. “I'm not fucking stupid kid, I'm clean of that shit.”

Jimin smiles softly, features lighting up. He looks frail. He looks easy to break. Yoongi remembers Jin's words.

“How is Gao? I mean with you, how does he treat you?”

Jimin lets some ash fall in the ashtray before he answers.

“He spoils the fuck out of me. I guess he treats me well. It's not bad, probably the best job I ever had. He gives me so much money I almost don't know what to do with it, I can buy whatever I want.”

Yoongi hums and guesses that that's probably all a guy like Jimin actually needs. The boy looks like he really enjoys owning expensive stuff, Yoongi can't exactly blame him.

“Besides, Owner can barely get it up.”

Yoongi chokes on a lungful of smoke under Jimin's amused look.

“Shit.” Yoongi croaks and Jimin giggles.

“Too much information?”

“A little, yeah.”

“Well, it's true. I'm not surprised, with all the shit he takes. Heroin especially. He either can't get it up and, when he can, he can barely keep it up. So, yeah, it's one of the best jobs I ever had.”

Yoongi concedes him a smile. Well, Jimin clearly doesn't have a problem in admitting that Gao is disgusting.

“I hate it when he snorts cocaine off me, though. That shit makes him hard as wood.”

Yoongi frowns at his words, sitting a little straighter on the couch.

“Off you?”

Jimin nods, stomping the cigarette in the ashtray.

“He likes to snort it from my thighs. Owner loves it, really, he even takes pictures of the coke's stripes before he snorts them. Don't really blame him, I got nice legs.”

Yoongi didn't realize he was holding his breath until he inhales and his throat hurts.

“I don't like it when you call him owner.” he says “It's creepy.”

Jimin shrugs. “It's what he wants me to call him.”

“Don't call him that when you're here. Really, it's gonna give me fucking nightmares.”

Jimin looks at him for a few seconds, his gaze heavy with something that Yoongi can't recognize.

“Then what should I call him?”

“Call him with his name or whatever.”

The moment Yoongi says it Jimin visibly stiffens and now Yoongi knows what it is he saw in his eyes: fear.

“I can't call him with his name, Yoongi.” Jimin whispers.

Yoongi gulps and nods. That was stupid of him. He's forgetting one thing: if Jimin calls Gao “owner”, it's because Gao literally owns him.

“No, you're right. Sorry.”

“It's okay. It's not like I enjoy calling him owner.” Jimin grimaces “Don't... tell him I said that.”

“I won't. I won't tell him a single thing you tell me when you're here.” Yoongi smiles when he sees Jimin relaxing “Still, there's no way I'll hear the word “owner” one more time. Pick a nickname or something.”

Jimin squints his eyes, clearly giving it some thought.

“How do you call an older person in korean? Just... a plain, mundane older person.”

Yoongi can feel the corner of his mouth curling up in a satisfied smile.

“Ajussi.” he replies.

“That's how I'll call him when I'm with you, then. Ajussi.” he says it as if he's tasting the way the word is on his tongue “I like it. I like spending time with you.”

Yoongi arches an eyebrow. “You like spending time with a druglord?”

“You're nice. And kind.”

“You don't know me, Jimin. Kind is not a word that people use when they talk about me.”

Yoongi almost feels shame if he thinks that Jimin finds him “kind”. Yoongi is a criminal, Yoongi has done things so shady and dark that sometimes they still haunt him in his sleep. Just like Gao, Yoongi has blood on his hands and broken families on his conscience.

And yet, Jimin just smiles and this time it's different. This time his smile is real and warm, his eyes turn into crescents, almost disappearing and he looks like a kid.

“Yoongi, trust me, you're kind.” Jimin stands up “I should go, the driver's waiting for me.”

Yoongi walks with him to the door and opens it for him, Jimin slips out his penthouse still wearing that smile.

“I'll see you next thursday, Yoongi.”

Yoongi nods, Jimin leaves.

When Yoongi closes the door behind the boy, the penthouse suddenly looks too big for him alone.

 

 

 

*

 

 

 

“All the stashes were dispatched.” Taehyung says, his head resting on Jungkook's lap and his legs sprawled all over his couch. Yoongi feels like he bought a couch that is way too comfortable since everyone feels entitled to just use it as they want.

“No problems?” Yoongi asks, going through some papers.

“Just a guy. What was his name again?” Taehyung asks Jungkook.

“Miles.” the boy replies, rubbing circles with his thumb on Taehyung's wrist “He's late with a payment. Didn't have enough money.”

“What did he buy?” Yoongi asks.

Jungkook shrugs. “Nothing big, just some pills. He swore he'll pay the total amount next time.”

“How much money does he owe us?”
